alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 4:33PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN SEQUATCHIE AND CENTRAL HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 615 PM EDT/515 PM CDT/... At 533 PM EDT/433 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dunlap, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Soddy-Daisy, Signal Mountain, Walden, Lakesite, Fairmount, Red Bank, Flat Top Mountain, North Chickamauga Creek Gorge, and Lone Oak. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
